description:
Not sure why some of the reviewers are confused .
Set the group code to the same thing on both devices. That's it. It works.

If this is catching people out, to be more user friendly maybe the dev could add a pop up that tells a user to set up the group code on both devices during first use?

It worked for me on Steam Deck. If your Steam Deck isn't able to find your PC, follow these steps: 

1 - Check that both devices are on the same network. Having both a 5 GHz and 2.4 GHz is increasingly common now. If your PC is on LAN, connect it to the same wifi network. Or plug an ethernet cable into your steam deck dock.

2 - Check the group code in Preferences > Connection'. These should be the same by default but if they aren't for some reason, your 2 devices won't connect. 

3 - On your PC and also in 'Preferences > Connection', change the 'Network interface to use' to the one for the network your devices are on. For me, I had to change this to my Wi-Fi card/adapter instead of 'Automatic' since it was presumably using my ethernet's interface (which would be on a different network from my Wi-Fi Steam Deck)
summary: Works for Steam Deck after changing settings

If using it to transfer files from a MicroSD, download and launch Flatseal, select Warpinator, scroll down to Filesystem, and add /run/media/mmcblk0p1 in Other files.

description: please fix it .gave permissions and cant change itl

It was really confusing at first, but all you have to do is to check two things: change the connection from "Automatic" to manually select network interface. For example, SteamDeck has wlan by default. Do the same on your PC. The second one: is to set up the Group Code for both SteamDeck and PC. Do not worget to do that, by default it is set up to "Warpinator". You might want to change one. So, it worked for me, I hope it will work for you.
summary: Works nice between SteamDeck and WIndows 10 PC

description: If you can't see the SD Card on Steam Deck, you must first learn how flatpak apps work. Similarly to Android, apps are given certain permissions that the user can enable. Download Flatseal - an app for flatpak permission management and give Warpinator access to the SD card mount point. Boom, done, and you learned something.
summary: READ IF YOU CAN'T SEE SD CARD ON DECK

Das Programm hat offenbar ein Eigenleben, denn es scheint wohl Tagesform abhängig zu sein, ob der Warpinator funktioniert oder nicht.
Bei der ersten Installation hat es tatsächlich funktioniert; allerdings nur 1x!
Dann ging die Fehlersuche los, bis jemand in einem Forum den Tipp gab, keinen Code einzutragen. Das war eine gute Idee, denn der Warpinator funktionierte wieder. Als ich dann das Programm noch einmal nutzen wollte, wurde wieder einmal nichts gefunden und Zugriff auf Daten schon wieder nicht möglich.

Wo der Fehler liegt - also beim Programm für den PC oder aber bei der App (Android), lässt sich nicht ausmachen.

Unter Windows gibt es merkwürdigerweise keinerlei Probleme; aber ich bin ja nicht einfach auf LM umgestiegen weil Windows so toll ist ...

Es tut mir schon fast leid, aber ein Stern ist gerade noch so drin. Vielleicht sollte der Programmierer mal überprüfen ob eine bestimmte Android-Version herumzickt, um dann nachzubessern, denn es ist ja ein wirklich nützliches Programm...wenn es klappt.
summary: Der Warpinator macht mich echt fertig ... :-(
